title: Testrepo setup causes `git push` to fail
body:
Here is the story: I have a non-bare repo that is clean and set up for pushing directly into it

````
mih@meiner /tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2 (git)-[master] % git config --list |grep receive
receive.denycurrentbranch=updateInstead
mih@meiner /tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2 (git)-[master] % git status
On branch master
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/master'.
nothing to commit, working tree clean
````

I have a clone of it also:

````
mih@meiner ...p_test_publish_recursiveuDdu37/subm 2 (git)-[master] % git remote -v
origin	/tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2 (fetch)
origin	/tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2 (push)
target	/tmp/datalad_temp_test_publish_recursiveOwurEY (fetch)
target	/tmp/datalad_temp_test_publish_recursiveOwurEY (push)
````

However, I cannot push to origin, because Git claims origin is not clean -- except Git confirmed before that it is:

````
mih@meiner ...p_test_publish_recursiveuDdu37/subm 2 (git)-[master] % git push
Counting objects: 6, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (5/5), done.
Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 683 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 6 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)
To /tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (Working directory has unstaged changes)
error: failed to push some refs to '/tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2'
````

I can do this multiple times (rechecking that origin is still clean), and also naming the remote explicitly -- no luck:

````
1 mih@meiner ...p_test_publish_recursiveuDdu37/subm 2 (git)-[master] % git push origin
Counting objects: 6, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (5/5), done.
Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 683 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 6 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)
To /tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (Working directory has unstaged changes)
error: failed to push some refs to '/tmp/datalad_temp_testrepo_6H1oIv/subm 2'
````

and the clone is clean too (although this should not matter at all)

````
mih@meiner ...p_test_publish_recursiveuDdu37/subm 2 (git)-[master] % git st
On branch master
Your branch is ahead of 'origin/master' by 2 commits.
  (use "git push" to publish your local commits)
nothing to commit, working tree clean
````

@bpoldrack @yarikoptic Can anyone enlighten me please?

(and BTW this is happening in our tests, I am simply exposing Git's errors now...)
